data.title: Good lunch place
data.text: We had the shawarma manouche (grilled chicken on flat bread with sauce and slices of dill pickles)- I removed the dill pickles and asked for a side of the red pickled turnips and received a complimentary serving. Good hummus. The dessert crepe with berries looked tempting but we were full.

data.title: Fantastic dinner!
data.text:
We stopped by with friends recently for dinner. Had read good reviews already and we were not disappointed.

When we arrived the place was packed both inside and outside but luckely as we were studying the menu a table opened and we were able to sit. You can eat in or also order take out here.

We started off with a serving of humus and chips which was delicious. After that we order the chicken shoarma with different sides.

It took a while for the shoarma to come and the owner apologised various times for that. We were not in a hurry and enjoyed the evening so all was well. Also we were given free salad and pita, to eat with the humus, as we waited.

It was worth the waiting. The shoarma was delicious. Good serving; chicken was succulent and very tasty. You can see the traditional hand in this meal. The lebanese salad was also very fresh and tasty.

As dessert we had baklava which was also very good!

This is a really good place and recommend people to come over for a nice dinner!

data.title: Not as good as I expected
data.text: After reading reviews I expected really good Middle Eastern food. It turned out to be so-so. Parking is okay located near the back of a little neighborhood mall. Has about eight tables and you order at the counter from the overhead menu. Servers are friendly but harried. We ordered a vegetarian platter with hummus, tabouli, falafel and such. It wasn't bad, but it wasn't great either. It came with pita which tasted flat and hard. The Zaatar pizza was interesting. I'll have to look elsewhere for good Mediterranean food.

data.title: I love ethnic foods
data.text: I bought food to go.  I liked what I bought and want to return to try more items on their menu.  The hummus was great and so was the falafel.  I've bought falafel other places and it was dry but this was not overcooked and it was really delicious.

data.title: Awesome!!! Great little secret!!
data.text:
This place is amazing!!! It's really tiny and not fancy, and usually busy but definitely worth any wait! Everything is amazing! Definitely a must try!!! The owners are so nice and very attentive! 

I have been here a few times and it's so delicious!!! I have had the chicken shawarma sandwich, which is large and delicious! The chicken is seasoned well and the veggies are fresh, crisp and delicious. I previously tried the Lebanese pizza which is so good and garlicky. I also have tried the spinach pie which like a great little baked spinach empanada with roasted tomatoes. Lastly, the baklava is so flaky and they are generous with the pistachios.

data.title: Good Lebanese food
data.text: Good tabbuli, kababs very good.  A modest shop in an unassuming strip mall. Was greeted upon entry, clean and friendly service.  Mike was wonderful recommending dishes. A busy place during lunch but worth your time.

data.title: Excellent falafel plate
data.text: The falafel was delicately flavored, the hummus creamy and tasty, the tabouli refreshing and the pickled beet salad not too sour.  There was more than enough food for one meal, and it came in its own to-go serving box.  I look forward to trying the manouche.  One point off of rating for dirty table tops and a bathroom door that didn't lock.

data.title: Local Dive Secret, that will not stay a Secret
data.text:
OMG, thank God, boring Ventura finally has authentic middle eastern food.  To get good Hummus you have to go LA, now Ventura is going to be on the cuisine map.

We went on the whim to check out this new restaurant, not thinking the food would be any good.  Boy were we surprised.  The owner and the chef, makes all the food there fresh and per order.  Not some premade, bought in bulk from Food Vendor.  

You can taste the freshness in the salads, chicken, and that falafel was the best I had in the past ten years.

Come there fast, before the lines become to long.
